name: Kelmans–Seymour conjecture
rephrased: A highly connected graph that cannot be drawn on a plane without crossings must contain a subdivision of the complete graph K5.
implication_form: If a graph is 5-vertex-connected and non-planar, then it contains a subdivision of K5.
explained: The Kelmans–Seymour conjecture states that every 5-vertex-connected graph that is non-planar contains a subdivision of the complete graph K5. In other words, if a graph is highly connected (specifically, 5-vertex-connected) and cannot be embedded in the plane without edge crossings, then it must contain a structure that resembles K5 with edges subdivided.
